ideas.idea_title: CONCEPT EXAMPLE ONLY: Target Trend Tour
ideas.idea_description: College students need to find inspiration to furnish their college dorms, but due to their lack of experience furnishing rooms, they do not know where to start.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: Many Guests complained about not being able to find good inspiration for their college dorms. Any inspiration they could find was only available online, making it difficult to gain an understanding of how different home decor pieces come together in real life.
ideas.idea_solution: Target Trend Tour is a truck that visits college campuses and exposes college students to room layouts furnished with Target decor items. College students can go into the truck, experience the room, and select online the pieces they would like to buy. Also, every college student who visits Trend Truck is entered to win a full dorm room makeover!

ideas.idea_description: Emerging product entrepreneurs are capable of coming with some of the best product innovations, but they struggle to get their products to market due to inexperience and a lack of resources, causing significant delays when trying to serve their target customers.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: Entrepreneurs cited frustration understanding how to develop and source their products. When asked about trying to get their products in retail locations, they didn't know where to even begin when it came to getting in touch with retailers.
ideas.idea_solution: Target Launch will provide entrepreneurs with the resources and mentorship they need through a nurturing relationship to help them develop their product, build their company, and bring their innovative solution exclusively to Targets everywhere.

ideas.idea_title: Cart Meals Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Curated Healthy Recipes on Carthweel
ideas.idea_description: Moderate and Proactive Demanding Enthusiasts are deeply concerned with healthy eating decisions, but struggle to consistently make these right choices due to lack of proactive investigation, fear of higher prices in healthier food options and limited interaction on accepted mediums at point of conflict, causing detrimental choices related to food quality.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: Moderate and Proactive Demanding Enthusiasts identified two major obstacles in their wellness journey, specifically as it relates to healthy meals:  Time and Cost.  Lack of available time to proactively research meal options is an issue due to these guestÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s increasingly prioritized obligations, including busy work hours, social events, school and family obligations to name a few.  Even when time allows, the cost of healthy food is another concern.  These guests went as far as to say that healthy food options are often unaffordable.  They struggle to find inspiration in a timely manner at a reasonable cost.
ideas.idea_solution: Cart Meals utilizes the widely-accepted and popular Cartwheel platform to provide curated, healthy recipe options to these Moderate and Proactive Demanding Enthusiasts at a point of great conflict Ã¢â‚¬â€œ the ill-prepared grocery store visit.  Cart Meals healthy recipes are comprised exclusively of products listed on the Weekly Ad or Cartwheel and are redeemable with one-click, providing a path of least resistance to the guest to address time constraints while going easy on their wallet and pushing them closer to healthier food choices.

ideas.idea_title: Just For You Portable Health Guide
ideas.idea_description: Many younger Target guests donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have healthy role models to from whom they can learn how to eat and live well. Some Target guests are confused by conflicting information about what is Ã¢â‚¬Å“healthyÃ¢â‚¬Â, or are overwhelmed by the sheer volume of information about health and wellness currently available. Still other guests want to make positive changes to improve their wellness, but donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have the time or patience to sort through volumes of information in order to make the decisions that will lead them down the path of good health. The Just For You Portable Health Guide addresses all of these barriers to improving personal health and wellness.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
A new college student who is living apart from her family for the first time needs to learn how to cook healthy meals for herself and how to eat an overall healthy diet. But growing up, her parents and grandparents focused on buying food that was inexpensive versus healthy; so now as a young adult on her own, she isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t sure what Ã¢â‚¬Å“healthyÃ¢â‚¬Â food really is. She has tried to do some research on the topic, but finds conflicting information that ends up making her feel frustrated and confused; and with her college classes becoming more demanding, she needs to focus more on her course load and less on food research.

A middle aged adult has always prided himself on being active and healthy; he has played sports all of his life, and eats a mostly nutritious diet. But as research continues to define which foods really support wellness, he finds himself questioning some of his knowledge and choices. For example, heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not sure if Greek yogurt is really worth the hype, if vitamin supplements are necessary, etc. HeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s also noticing that over the past few years, he has started to gain a little weight Ã¢â‚¬â€œ which was never an issue for him before. HeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not sure what changes he should make, but knows that he needs to do something if he wants to remain in good shape in the years to come.
ideas.idea_solution: The Just For You Portable Health Guide is a mobile tool that allows a guest to select specific elements of health that they want to focus on Ã¢â‚¬â€œ everything from losing weight, to lowering blood sugar, to increasing bone density, to reducing cholesterol, and on and on. In the store, when the guest comes across an item that they arenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t sure supports their specified health goals, they simply scan the itemÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s barcode, and receive instant feedback on whether the item is a good choice, or if there is a better alternative close by. The just-in-time information instantly clarifies if the item in question supports good health (as defined by the guest), and eliminates the lack of role models or gaps in knowledge of what Ã¢â‚¬ËœhealthyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ is compared to the ever-evolving research and resulting information. Because the guide is so simple to use and provides immediate results, a guestÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s patience isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t strained, and their already hectic schedule isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t negatively impacted.

ideas.idea_title: Well. Done!  Fresh-prepped meals boxed at your local Target.
ideas.idea_description: The market is flooded with unhealthy but convenient dinner options whether you eat in or out.  Parents with little time and/or skill still want to cook wholesome and complete meals for their families.  Ready-to-cook options are often full of preservatives or have had much of the taste frozen out of them.  When a healthy meal is cooked at home it usually requires advance planning Ã¢â‚¬â€œ what to make, ingredients to get, thawing meat in time, etc. There exists a need for fast, fresh home-cooked meals that are uncompromising in taste, quality and nutritional value without having to think too hard about how to accomplish it.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
Ask anyone what the biggest barriers to consistently offering healthy home-cooked meals are and the answers will invariably center on time and cost. As Gina D put it, Ã¢â‚¬Å“It takes time to plan healthy mealsÃ¢â‚¬Â¦and cook. This occurs in addition to work, studying and family life.Ã¢â‚¬Â The perception that healthy food is always more expensive is also pervasive. Lauren says, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Produce and healthy perishable food is so expensive that I canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t afford itÃ¢â‚¬Â

Online options such as Blue Apron and Plated aim to fill this gap by delivering fully boxed and pre-portioned gourmet meals right to your door via a subscription service. While they are scoring high marks for taste, quality and nutritional value, their current price of $10-15 per plate is steep considering you still have to cook the meal.

With TargetÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s scale there is an opportunity to fill this whitespace with healthy and affordable meals.
ideas.idea_solution:
Guests simply order via a standalone app or an integrated feature within the current Target app. They select the number of plates, dietary restrictions and the type of food theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re in the mood for. A curated list of recipes appears with an associated cost/plate. All meals are guaranteed to be well-balanced in nutritional value. Once the order is complete, the local Target store received the order and begins to box up the necessary ingredients for the guest to complete the recipe. Fresh meat, produce and spices are all pre-portioned and ready to for the guest to use. Nothing is frozen, pre-packaged or pre-cooked. This is not Mix & Match Ã¢â‚¬â€œ these are curated gourmet recipes using fresh ingredients that regularly rotate at your local Target.


Once in the store the guests collects his/her box at the deli counter and heads home to cook. Alternatively, guests could also order in store at an ipad station and continue their shopping trip while the box is assembled. They simply pick it up before completing their trip.

Once at home guests simply follow the easy full-color recipe card to make a fresh, gourmet, and most importantly healthy home-cooked meal for their family.

If you want dinner done well Ã¢â‚¬â€œ order it Well. Done!

ideas.idea_title: DriverÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Seat: The app that syncs the authenticity of healthy recipe discovery with the benefits of TargetÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s promotional vehicles.
ideas.idea_description:
The core consumer (Elizabeth) aspires for a sense of balance in her life and control over her familyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s and her own well being.



She aims to instill healthy eating habits on her family, but as the primary grocery shopper and meal preparer, she is intimidated by the perceived time and money associated with healthy cooking, as well as her lack of knowledge on healthy eating.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: Core consumers cited frustration that it is hard to eat well on a budget. There is a gap between discovering a healthy meal solution, identifying how much it will cost, and locating an affordable destination where she can go to get all of the needed ingredients.
ideas.idea_solution:
DriverÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Seat will allow her to discover a proactive, easy, and rewarding way to tweak her shopping routine to instill healthy eating habits on her family, and have greater control over their well being.



By highlighting nutritional and monetary benefits, and providing clarity and transparency for how she can save time and money, she will gain that sense of balance and control that she has been aspiring to achieve. (Check out the video below to see Elizabeth navigate the app!)

ideas.idea_title: Easy Eats: save well, eat well, be well
ideas.idea_description: Dana has a family and is digitally connected Ã¢â‚¬â€œ using her smartphone to find tips and ideas for living a healthy lifestyle.  She feels like a good parent when she finds healthy food choices for her family, but sheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s overwhelmed with how stressful it can be to find and prepare the right meals AND get to her fitness class.  The effort she puts in leaves her without the time and energy that she needs to focus on the other well-being priorities in her life.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: They feel challenged finding time to work, eat healthy AND exercise.  They believe being healthy reduces stress, but they become stressed in trying to be healthy.  Many people donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t understand what foods are healthy, they may not understand packaging, ingredients and nutrition information.  They struggle to find meals that appeal to everyone in the family. They want healthy to be affordable.
ideas.idea_solution: Dana will order Target-assembled meals through a user-friendly mobile application.Ã‚Â  SheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be able to select meals by category (e.g. Ã¢â‚¬Ëœlow calorieÃ¢â‚¬â„¢, Ã¢â‚¬Ëœgluten freeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢) that are assembled for her, taking the stress out of meal planning and shopping.Ã‚Â  When assembling her meals, Dana will be able to choose the number of servings, view nutrition information, select sides, and view photos. Ã‚Â And weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll take the guess work and research out of healthy by guaranteeing the Ã¢â‚¬Å“dirty dozenÃ¢â‚¬Â are organic. SheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll have flexibility to select the date she wants her meal (s) with options like home delivery or deli pick-up at her Target store. Ã‚Â She can simply pull a meal out of the fridge and serve or bake it, allowing her to focus on family.Ã‚Â  SheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll spend less time looking for recipes, shopping for ingredients, and preparing dinner and more time for fitness and her other well-being priorities.

Many of our Guests care about organic and natural groceries, but donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t realize how many options Target actually carries, because those items are spread outÃ¢â‚¬â€essentially Ã¢â‚¬Å“hiddenÃ¢â‚¬Â amongst all our other products throughout the grocery department. As a result, we believe many of them have to make an extra trip to Whole Foods for just a few organic items to finish their shopping list. This increases their budget for groceries and the number of items on their "To-Do" list. Getting everything they need at Target, in one place, saves time and money.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
Guest Insights research indicates that millennial guests often prefer organics, and care about how their food was produced. We have an opportunity to earn credibility in this area, and help them find more of these items at affordable prices during their regular Target run.


Industry researcher, Farnoosh Torabi of Yahoo Shopping conducted a study comparing the organic shopping experience at Whole Foods and at Target, and pointed out that, "Nearly half of the 250 items in TargetÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Simply Balanced line is organic, but to be honest it wasnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t so easy to locate what we were looking for in the store."


Overall, her recommendation to the millennial audience is that, "If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re committed to eating organic and want the best selection, Whole Foods is your best bet. There are plenty of organic products within their 365 Everyday Value brand and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s organized in a way thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s easy to find.


But if you love one-stop shopping at a discount retailer and want to sprinkle some organic food in your diet, Target works."


Target is less expensive and has the product selection she's looking for. We just need to help her more easily find it.
ideas.idea_solution:
Guests can use our "Organic Food Finder" in the Target app to view their Target store through an organic lens, which filters out everything but organic food items and shows their exact placement in their store on an intuitive map.


It also raises her awareness of our organic product selection, and eliminates her need to make an extra trip.

ClickCart is the first platform to combine:
- Social Media Inspiration

ideas.idea_guest_insight:
Majority of consumers:
- Use social media apps
- Enjoy cooking healthy meals
- Appreciates the convenience of online shopping
- Pins recipes on Pinterest and follows social media posts, but rarely brings the recipes to life
- Would make Target their primary store if pick up in store or delivery was an option for groceries
ideas.idea_solution:
1. Find inspiration on social media
2. Click Ã¢â‚¬ËœAdd to CartÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ to add to Target.com shopping cart
3. Customize selection and checkout
4. Pick up the groceries in store at your convenience

ideas.idea_description:
****Please see our video using the link at the bottom or going directly to https://vimeo.com/118864856 (password="crowd")*****

Meet Jane, a busy, young professional mother of two, who is passionate about living well. She strives to reduce her stress, spend quality time with her family and provide healthy meals for them. She gets overwhelmed with the entire process of planning and preparing healthy meals, which takes away from her ability to spend time with her family. She becomes paralyzed by the countless recipes on the internet that have too many ingredients or are so complex they take hours to prepare. As a result, she resorts to the same (not so healthy) meals she always prepares which require less creativity, effort and money.

She needs to be able to prepare a healthy meal in a stress-free way and spend quality time with her family.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
Busy moms that want to prepare healthy meals but the time involved and the complexity of actually preparing the meals is difficult. Recipes are one of the most googled search terms. There is also a knowledge gap of how to cook a healthy meal and a perception that healthy doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t always equal delicious. Per guest insights, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Across all segments, motivation is the top barrier to wellness. Cost and time are also validated as key friction points.Ã¢â‚¬Â Ã¢â‚¬Å“All segments struggle with eating well consistently and feeling like they have room to improve.Ã¢â‚¬Â

In the marketplace we observed multiple options to satisfy different parts of this need.

Whole Foods - From a retailer perspective, Whole Foods has an app that adds to a shopping list, but it doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t calculate cost and the shopping list isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t user friendly.

Big Oven - another app that lets you search recipes and make filters, adding items to your meal plan and eventually your shopping list. The app is not tied to a retailer or specific items, and doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t show you the value you will get. There is also no store pickup or home delivery, some of the menu options are difficult to make, and it only addresses planning the meal, not shopping or preparation.

Hello Fresh - a subscription service that allows the consumer to choose from five recipes each week and you have to choose exactly three. The recipes are simple and easy to prepare and there is home delivery. The meals themselves are at higher price point and if you like a meal it wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t necessarily be a choice the next week.

Most options in the market are not focused on simple, healthy meals unless consumers are willing to pay a premium.
ideas.idea_solution:
Plan - SheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll download the app for free, register (unless she already has Cartwheel or Target.com account), then she gets to choose her meals (from a few choices, trending dishes, 4 star or higher). There is a filter for food allergies and special dietary needs. All meals are healthy, easy to cook and prepared in 30 minutes or less.

Grocery shop - Her grocery list is created from the meal selections and the app selects Target grocery items that exist in the store. She has the option to remove any ingredients from the list if she already has them. The Cartwheel button at the bottom populates any available coupons, and then calculates the cost of her grocery list. If she wants to shop in store, the grocery list will display aisle locations. If she doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t want to shop in-store, she can click buy now and the groceries will be ready for pickup at a set time. A home delivery option is also available for her convenience.

Prepare - Simple step by step instructions and pictures guide her through the meal preparation. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s so simple her kids can cook the meal. She has the option to rate, share and favorite the meal, which creates a feedback loop and continues to personalize the experience.
ideas.idea_collaboration: Fia Wulur,Peter Staloch,Spencer Wiggins,Tracy Johnson,Ylan Kazi

ideas.idea_description:

While moms do everything in their power to keep their children healthy, they worry about those moments of the unknown. Whether an expecting mother wonders when she last felt her babyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s kick or her infant cries inconsolably at 3AM, there are so many moments where mom aspires for peace of mind that everything is okay. She struggles with the stress of the unknown and wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t rest until she can diagnose or treat her children, even if itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ahead of her own needs. She needs the tools to act in those moments, ultimately empowering her and delivering her the peace of mind she needs.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: When engaging with Target Guests, it quickly became abundantly clear momÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s biggest source of stress and anxiety was worrying about the health of their children. People spent hours searching online, consulting with close confidants, or traveling to and from doctorÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s offices for common treatments, all in search of peace of mind. We found the gap was empowering mom in her moment of need instead of taking the time to search out third party sources. Mom stresses in the moments where she lacks control of her childÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s health and wants the tools that empower her at that time.  Regardless of her childÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s age (Prenatal, Infant, Toddler, etc), she yearns to quickly control that anxiety and obtain greater peace of mind through quick diagnosis and care of her children.
ideas.idea_solution:
Today, we know that moms are visiting Target for their own and their families over-the-counter healthcare and Pharmacy needs.

Tomorrow, she will be able to rely on Target for new, innovative health care technology products that empower her to diagnose, monitor, and care for her children, regardless of age. For example, an expecting mom can use a new product to check her babyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s heartbeat and share a recording with her family and friends. Similarly, she can check for an ear infection, upload to a doctor, and pick up her prescription at a Target pharmacy without visiting a doctor's office or waiting room. Finally, she will be able to monitor her childÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s fever in real-time during their recovery.

Most exciting, she does not know that these products exist and are available to help her. She will engage with Target in a whole new way through interactive education, engagement with Pharmacy, and Target.com. Due to the newness, we will fuel her exploration through perfect placement displays and an interactive experience. Ultimately, these products will empower her and make Target her trusted destination for wellness throughout any of her familyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s life stages.

ideas.idea_description: We know that physical activity produces overall physical, psychological and social benefits, and that inactive children are likely to become inactive adults (from NFL Play60).  Many children spend their inactive time playing video games and apps.  While some game makers have attempted to increase the amount of movement involved in playing their games (Wii, Kinect, etc.), the amount of physical activity involved in playing these games is minimal.  There exists an opportunity to better connect active play with video games, a way to encourage the young gamers to get up and play in the real world.  The PowerChip Active does just this, by tracking the amount of time the child is actively moving during the day, the child earns in-game rewards, called PowerChips.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
Nathan, a 9 year old boy, loves to play video games, where he immerses himself in worlds where building and exploring, beating challenges, and gathering Ã¢â‚¬Å“coinsÃ¢â‚¬Â allow him to level up, gain new challenges, and customize his world and characters. When asked about why he likes to spend so much time in the games, Nathan answers, Ã¢â‚¬Å“I just want to see what is nextÃ¢â‚¬Â.






Becky, NathanÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s mom, knows the importance of active play, but struggles with the Nathan to get him up to do it. Just getting him off of his games is seen as a punishment. She wants her kids to WANT to get up and play.
ideas.idea_solution:
Kids simply clip the PowerChip Active onto their clothing or hold it in their pocket. The Chip is activated whenever the child moves, tracking the amount of time that this movement is happening (a minimum of 5 minutes of activity is required to Ã¢â‚¬Å“countÃ¢â‚¬Â and be tracked). They then connect the PowerChip Active to a PowerChip Sync Tower that recognizes the amount of (new) time tracked and adds it into a PowerChip bank within their game system.

Through partnerships with video game and app designers, PowerChip rewards are added into their new games, with exclusive rewards for Ã¢â‚¬Å“purchaseÃ¢â‚¬Â with PowerChips (power and ability upgrades, new missions or challenges, new skins and clothing, and other special customizations).

With the PowerChip Active and video games and apps with the embedded PowerChip currency, kids earn the gaming experience they love by getting the physical activity that they need.

ideas.idea_description: For time-starved individuals who want to maintain a workout routine without taking time away from other meaningful activities, Well by Target provides conveniently scheduled, capacity-controlled classes that you can join with your friends from anywhere you are, with a live trainer able to give you real-time feedback.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
Driving to and from fitness classes takes time. Being surrounded by ultra-fit classmates wearing expensive workout gear can be intimidating. Workout videos can become stale and uninspiring. Fitness routines can be hard to maintain if you do it alone, without support systems.
Well by Target removes the inconveniences and insecurities brought about by traditional fitness classes, while keeping you motivated with personal attention from your instructor and support from your friends.
ideas.idea_solution:
Log on to Well by Target and select a scheduled workout that interests you, a certified trainer you'd like to work with, or find one that your friends have already signed up for

Join at the scheduled time and stream the class live to your laptop, mobile device, or TV. Enable your own video to get additional pointers and feedback from your live instructor.

Get fit and chat with your friends about that last workout, or join communities to hold each other accountable.

Track your fitness goals and start earning Target rewards.

ideas.idea_description: Our guest Taylor tries her best to live up to her values and ambitions by eating healthy, sustainable food, but with a busy schedule and no culinary training, she lacks the time and expertise to prepare meals that match her aspirations and tastes. She is also overwhelmed by all the food options available to Ã¢â‚¬â€œ both when choosing where to shop and eat, and when shopping the aisles of Whole Foods or Target. As a result, she often ends up settling for meals that are uninspiring, unhealthy, and/or expensive. Target Plate allows Taylor to have it all: healthy, delicious, sustainable food at an affordable price that fits into her busy schedule.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: Taylor is faced with the challenge of eating healthy, delicious, sustainable food, while also leading a busy lifestyle and managing her budget. Many consumers fall victim to this dilemma and often end up settling for meals that are uninspiring, unhealthy, and/or expensive.
ideas.idea_solution:
One night, while watching Jimmy Fallon, Taylor sees a hilarious cooking segment featuring celebrity chef Jamie Oliver highlighting his new partnership with Target. He is showing how Target guests can conveniently pick up a pre-packed Target Plate box with all the necessary ingredients to prepare the healthy, delicious meals. Jaime also records the shows where he prepares each box so that guests can watch his video while learning how to prepare their meal. Alternatively, Taylor could just as easily have discovered through the cool, new interactive Target Plate kiosk or when she noticed her friends repining the Target Plate recipes on Facebook. The interactive kiosk allows her to sign-up for Target Plate, customize her dietary preferences and learn about her food choices.
Taylor is delighted to discover how quick and easy it is to stop by a Target store, pick up her Target Plate box, and use the healthy, fresh contents to prepare a delicious meal at home, all while being guided by Jamie OliverÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Target-exclusive web episodes and digital recipes that show her how to prepare the meal. She looks forward to her Target Plate box next week and plans to incorporate it into her weekly routine.

ideas.idea_title: Wellness ONE SCAN Plan  - Please view URL: https://sway.com/fFmO4Vi0rzEHw87o
ideas.idea_description: Consumers that are looking to track their food purchases and financial history can do so with one barcode scan.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: Consumers are using a multitude of apps such as Mint, WellsFargo for personal banking to view expenditure.  They are also using food journals such as myfitness pal and fooducate to track and score food.  This is time intensive and requires using multiple apps.  Many consumers want better tracking to start better behavior.
ideas.idea_solution:
Consumers can scan products to create and upload their food lists, while adding relevant cartwheel savings to their barcode.







After uploading the lists they monitor week by week spending and food behaviors. They can also set goals within food plans if they want to adhere to a certain diet plan, like paleo, to see how their purchases align to the plan.

ideas.idea_title: Financial Wellness-  Saving plan for families by using their RedCard
ideas.idea_description: Financial saving for college is a task that is always on 'the list'.  This program will start and consistently add funds to the childs post secondary education and make saving money an easy process.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: I observed, parents sharing their support for education and wanting to save for their childrenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s college fund.  They all said, it was on their list to get to.  Families are saving less than $16,000 by the time the child attends college. Education saving plans are not publicized, but one time a year.  The cost of post-secondary school is rising, prohibiting many students from attending college.
ideas.idea_solution: The guest will sign up online for a state sponsored education savings plan.  They will connect the Target RedCard to their account.   As guest make purchases at Target, 1% of their purchases will be automatically applied to their education savings account.  If a family does not have children, they could set up the account to go to the Target Scholarship fund, which would support individual and post-secondary organizations.

ideas.idea_description: Meet Ben, a recent college graduate who is now tossed into the real world where magical dining halls and college days of ramen don't exist anymore.  Ben has been living off of frozen foods and takeout for months because he can't cook.  After feeling the impact of his food choices causing him to have less energy at work - not to mention his hurting wallet - he has decided to make a change.  He wants to create his own meals and save money while he pays off his college loans.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: The overwhelming majority of people interviewed mentioned eating well as their primary obstacle to physical health.  The main roadblock was the inability to cook, followed by the perception that healthy foods are more expensive.
ideas.idea_solution:
Our Concept is Target EZ Meals.
It is a cellphone app that has a built in recipe book.
Unique to this recipe book is that it links with Target pricing info to know what items are on sale (Circular, TPCs, etc).
The App allows the user to drill down into recipes based upon main ingredients (suggestions based on weekly deals), number of servings, preparation time, as well as nutritional value in a number of categories.
After a person selects their recipe in the app, the app directs the person to the location of the ingredients in the store and tells them the total price of the ingredients used in the recipe.
The intended audience is people who do not know how to cook and/or want to save money.

ideas.idea_description: The Target guest is searching for free and convenient community events & activities that can educate, inspire, and engage  their families while helping them to make smarter choices about the things they feel support their wellness.  Target is searching for ways to integrate our 1800+ neighborhood stores into the community to help drive store traffic and make Target a destination for the guest.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: The Target guest has an abundance of shopping choices (both online and in brick & mortar) and yet they often are confused about how to make the best choices to improve their families wellness while they shop.  They are looking to experience and be educated/inspired by wellness solutions that Target can offer.
ideas.idea_solution: By periodically sponsoring local community events in under-utilized Target store parking lots,  Target Neighborhood Events (TNEÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s) would draw local residents to the 1800+ Target store parking lots.  Once there, the guest and their families would participate in locally-customizable events and activities that support improved wellness and community spirit such as partnerships, for example, with local Veterinarians and Dept. 083 (pets).  The guest would learn about pet health at the TNE and then would receive special in-store savings on Boots & Barkley pet products for participating.

ideas.idea_title: It All Starts with a Lemon
ideas.idea_description:
Many of our guests want to lead healthier lifestyles but believe that healthier options are too expensive and confusing to navigate. Target can make Wellness accessible to guests by making organics more affordable and acting as a trusted partner to help the guest switch to healthier options.

Please watch our video to see how it all starts with a lemon!
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
We conducted a survey of friends, family and co-workers:

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢When asked what Ã¢â‚¬Å“wellnessÃ¢â‚¬Â meant to them, most people surveyed stated Ã¢â‚¬Å“eating healthyÃ¢â‚¬Â as a top response.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢After probing into barriers to eating healthy, many stated prohibitively high prices and the confusing options available.

Then we conducted some online and in store research:

-Organic produce costs about 20% more to produce BUT on average organic produce sells for 50% to 100% more
-70% of people who do not purchase organics state price as the #1 barrier
-See images for instore research
ideas.idea_solution:
Target will start by making a Wellness Price Guarantee by taking organic prices down to ideally be 20% or less price premium over traditional counterparts. Target will promote its Wellness Price Guarantee through marketing channels.

To assist the guest in developing healthy habits, we will offer Cartwheel Wellness Challenges within the Cartwheel app that will help the guest navigate healthy options and lead to healthier habits. When guests opt in to the Wellness Challenge, an example of a challenge is to scan a grocery item (for example, a lemon) and Cartwheel will suggest an organic or healthier option (an organic lemon) where available. If they purchase the healthier item on that trip, they will get the healthier item (organic lemon) for the price of the original item (lemon) they scanned.

If the guest starts accepting Wellness Challenges by buying healthier grocery items, Cartwheel will continue to prompt them to try healthier items throughout grocery (organic beef), and eventually in other areas of the store (natural beauty products, multivitamins, organic cotton sheets).

By taking a small step like purchasing an organic lemon, the guest starts her journey of trial into healthier options throughout the Target store and will realize that Target is the one stop shop for all her Wellness needs and the small price premium is worth the health benefits for her family.

Please watch our video to see how it all starts with a lemon!

ideas.idea_description:
*Please view video (link at the bottom)

Emily is a busy new mom. Her day is constantly filled with numerous choices. Should she let her baby sleep a little longer or wake her up and run to Target? Should she volunteer or make it home to put her baby down for nap time? Clip coupons or put together that new toy? This can be very demanding. While she knows how important it is for her to fit exercising and finding more ways to save money into her day, this just isn't currently possible. Emily wishes there was a way to integrate these healthy behaviors into her already full day and model them to her baby while taking some of the guesswork out of deciding how to fit them in.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: When connecting with and observing numerous Target Guests, it was clear that they see the importance of exercising, saving money, and giving back. Unfortunately, many of our guests lack the time and/or the motivation to pursue these healthy behaviors. In terms of exercising, they are already looking for ways to fit this into their every day (i.e. through wearing a Fitbit, Jawbone, etc.). They want a seamless experience that integrates each of these healthy behaviors into their busy lives and then be able to share what they are doing with their friends via social media.
ideas.idea_solution:
Target Steps is an app easily located within the Target App. As Emily visits Target, with baby in tow, Target Steps automatically tracks her steps (through GPS), earning her money along the way. She can then spend her earnings on reducing her bill, save her steps towards a badge in Cartwheel, or give her earnings to the charity of her choice. She can also earn money for her activity outside of Target and decide whether to spend, save, or give those earnings.

Emily can also share how much she has earned walking by inviting friends to use the app and show them how far she has gone, giving her that extra motivation to set wellness goals and keep them. By integrating more exercise, saving money, and giving back to the community into her already busy day, Emily can feel confident that she is modeling these healthy behaviors to her baby and caring for her own health at the same time.

ideas.idea_description: Not all calories are created equal, especially when we think about sports and performance.  Parents have the motivation to help their kids advance their athletic performance but donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have the knowledge.  We want to enhance our/our childrenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s performance rather than simply filling our/their stomachs.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: I experienced parents that felt guilty and confused.  They had children in sports but didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t know how to feed their kids to support the daily practices and games.  TheyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve given up on sugary sports drinks and performance supplements (bars, gels, etc).  Their kids need real food but what does that mean and does a football player need different meals than a cross country runner?
ideas.idea_solution:
(1) Sport/Activity specific meals that are easy to identify


(2) The right blend: Protein, Fats, Carbs and Vitamins


(3) Prepared fresh: at Target with Target sourced products





Consumers can have an experience with these meals in a variety of ways:


Parent Ã¢â‚¬â€œ eliminates confusion (premade, easy to identify sport meals, prepped at Target) while expanding knowledge (label with ingredients and ingredient percentages)


User Ã¢â‚¬â€œ healthy performance enhancement and encourage life-long healthy eating (routine and accessible ingredients).


Coach/Nutritionist Ã¢â‚¬â€œ submit customized meals based on athleteÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s needs and goals.

ideas.idea_description:
Video URL: https://vimeo.com/118947634

Our end user is Scott, a health-conscious, millennial father and family budget owner who often puts his family needs ahead of his own. He loves Target, loves to shop, and loves finding a good deal.

ScottÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s definition of wellness is maintaining Ã¢â‚¬Å“holistic balanceÃ¢â‚¬Â in his life which incorporates everything from healthy eating and regular exercise to spending quality time with his family. Though, in ScottÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s words, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Exercising regularly and eating healthy foods are the two biggest components of wellness for me.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Scott needs a way to help provide consistent, holistic, balanced wellness for himself and for his family. But frustratingly, he struggles to find the personal motivation to consistently exercise and also the ability to provide more affordable, healthy food options for his family.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
Scott told us, Ã¢â‚¬Å“I donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t always have time to work out with my busy schedule.Ã¢â‚¬Â But after observing his behavior, we discovered that despite his busy schedule, lack of motivation was actually the biggest barrier preventing him from exercising on a more consistent basis, NOT lack of time. We also learned that in the past, incentives and social factors have been the two types of motivations that have been most effective in spurring Scott to exercise.

TargetÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Guest Insights research validates this observation, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Across all segments, motivation is the top barrier to wellness. Cost and time are also validated as key friction points.Ã¢â‚¬Â Ã¢â‚¬Å“All segments struggle with eating well consistently.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Scott also said, Ã¢â‚¬Å“IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d like to purchase healthy, natural, and organic foods and produce more often, but these items are usually so much more expensive that I canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t always afford them and stay within my budget.Ã¢â‚¬Â We observed that Scott regularly purchases a variety of snacks and foods for his family, for most of which exist higher-priced, healthier or organic alternatives.

Lastly, we also observed how fulfilling it is for Scott to find a deal or receive a discount on a purchase. He often shares his bargain discoveries and how much he saved with close family members and friends.
ideas.idea_solution:
The Target Wellness Program allows guests to earn discounts on Ã¢â‚¬Å“wellnessÃ¢â‚¬Â items at Target (such as healthy, natural, and organic foods) by completing certain Ã¢â‚¬Å“wellnessÃ¢â‚¬Â activities (such as working out and exercising). With the help of this new program, Scott can both find the motivation to exercise regularly AND afford to purchase healthier foods for his family in order to help them all live more balanced, healthy lives.

ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Sunday, and Scott is in charge of making dinner for his family tonight. While evaluating the options, he could just order out pizza again because itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s quick and easy, but he feels guilty that he isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t providing his family with healthier foods. Adding to his guilt is the fact that he failed to work out this morning like he had plannedÃ¢â‚¬Â¦again.

Scott remembers that he recently downloaded an app that gives deals on healthier food options through Target when he works out. Scott opens the app and finds an Archer Farms Organic Veggie Pizza and sees he only needs another 200 points to redeem the discount. Within the app there is also a list of exercises and activities he can do and how many points he will earn for doing each. The points can then be redeemed for any discount he sees. ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s even the option to sync up a FitBit and earn points for the activity it tracks.

Scott then completes various exercises and tracks them in his Target Wellness Program. On his way home from working out, he redeems the discount on the Archer Farms Veggie Pizza to make for dinner for his family. Scott feels a new sense of balance return to his life using the Target Wellness Program to motivate him to consistently exercise, and provide healthy food for his family on a budget.

ideas.idea_description:
Wellness cannot be summed up by one action alone. For many people it is a sum total of eating healthy, physical fitness and relationships being in balance or a place of peace. Regardless of where the Guest fell on the Ã¢â‚¬Å“Wellness SpectrumÃ¢â‚¬Â the recurring theme of the following three basic barriers surfaced.

Lack of information, time and connection stands in the way of achieving wellness.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
Moderate: Shannon a stay at home mom, (37, married, 2 kids) strives to maintain a balance of physical, mental and spiritual health by setting small achievable goals and resetting them as her family achieves them. SheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s teaching herself a more healthy way to cook and feed her family by doing research on the Internet and reaching out to friends and family that she views as healthy. However, being overwhelmed by too many activities makes it difficult to maintain and she slips into old habits; losing the time to research recipes, prep and cook.

Proactive: Sarah a working mother, (36, married, 1 kid) is willing to make multiple stops at different stores in order to purchase organic or from transparent food sources. She seeks out blogs that provide her with healthy recipes, family friendly solutions and exercise routines. Maintaining a planned regiment of daily meals and physical activities keeps her family on track and her migraines at bay. Unfortunately, stress from work makes it difficult for her to maintain and she loses time to plan and prep leading to unhealthy choices for her family.

Both Shannon and Sarah confirm the conclusions of the Wellness Fact Pack. They want to eat healthier, improve their physical fitness and maintain balanced relationships. But feelings of being overwhelmed by activities and stress block their path. Both seek out connections with other people who they view as being healthy.

Sarah, the proactive is already shopping in places that offer her the connected or trustworthy source. For example: her local farmers market where she can speak directly with the grower, Trader Joes where the sample person tells her about a lower priced item that is just as good as the more expensive one. Lululemon offers in store yoga class.

Based on the Macro trend series presented by Target Creative Strategy our demanding enthusiasts want: Unfiltered truth & unwavering values. To co-create, collaborate and be a part of the process. Expect seamless, frictionless, convenience. Data distilled for a more personalized experience. Care about connections and not just transactions. Plus, have self-awareness, a positive image & lasting impact.
ideas.idea_solution:
At the heart of our stores is the Ã¢â‚¬Å“Wellness HubÃ¢â‚¬Â, a flexible space that can change and evolve to meet our Guest where they are at. This space can house Registered Dieticians lecturing, or demonstrating healthy cooking that would feature owned brand food along with take away meal plans and coupons. Fitness experts to demonstrate different workout equipment or consult one-on-one to develop a workout routine for the whole family. Just purchased a new electronic device? Our tech experts can help decipher that new FitBit, tablet, or phone. The stylist can help you find just the right outfit for the job interview, wedding, or even meeting the parents.

Localized weekly schedules of the wellness hub are communicated via: email, text messages, on target.com and in-store postings. This would include any special promotions or collaborations.

We fullfill our Guests needs when we meet them where they are at.

They've given up on sugary sports drinks and performance supplements (bars, gels, etc).  Their kids need real food but what does that mean and does a football player need different meals than a cross country runner?

ideas.idea_title: Healthy Corner. It's as easy as 1, 2, 3!
ideas.idea_description: Consumers have the desire to eat healthy.  However, due to time constraints and lack of guidance they find it difficult to come up with quick and healthy food options.  They rely on quick meals via restaurants due to their frustration of grocery shopping and lack of diverse and easy meal ideas.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: Upon entering the store they become overwhelmed with all of the options and the time it takes to locate items.  As a result they become annoyed with their shopping experience and leave with an empty cart and a personal pan pizza from Pizza Hut in their hand.  Not a healthy way to end the day.
ideas.idea_solution:
Our concept will provide our guests with healthy meal options both home and in-store. Target will create a front and center Healthy Corner destination in replacing all Pizza Huts and Target Cafes. Target will be providing an amazing in-store experience offering 3 stations.



Station 1 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Ã¢â‚¬Å“Taste and LearnÃ¢â‚¬Â offering a test kitchen that will showcase chef demos along with taste testingÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s of healthy recipes.



Station 2 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Ã¢â‚¬Å“Help and ShopÃ¢â‚¬Â will provide a wall of recipe ideas and a concierge that will quickly assist you by grabbing your recipe items.



Station 3 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Ã¢â‚¬Å“Grab and GoÃ¢â‚¬Â gives the guest the opportunity to utilize the grab and go wellness bar for a quick snack or a full meal that they can enjoy in the dining area.



Thanks to the Wellness Indicator, the guest will become educated on how to take the guess work out of smart choices by informing them of both nutrition and energy information.



Healthy Corner. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s as easy as 1, 2, 3.
