ideas.idea_title: FINANCIAL WELLNESS:  EDUCATION SAVING PLAN USING THEIR REDCARD
ideas.idea_description: Financial saving for college is a task that is always on 'the list'. This program will start and consistently add funds to the childÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s post-secondary education and make saving money an easy process.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: I observed, parents sharing their support for education and wanting to save for their childrenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s college fund. They all said, it was on their list to get to. Families are saving less than $16,000 by the time the child attends college. Education saving plans are not publicized, but one time a year. The cost of post-secondary school is rising, prohibiting many students from attending college.
ideas.idea_solution: The guest will sign up online for a state sponsored education savings plan. They will connect the Target RedCard to their account. As guest make purchases at Target, 1% of their purchases will be automatically applied to their education savings account. If a family does not have children, they could set up the account to go to the Target Scholarship fund, which would support individual and post-secondary organizations.

ideas.idea_description:
Individual health is at the foundation of day to day life; impacting every aspect of life from work to family to recreation, good health is transformative. Yet, acting alone, without reinforcing social and economic environments, no individual can achieve their optimal health.
It isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t a simple matter of motivation; the context of peopleÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s lives determines their health: income and social status, education, physical activity, social support networks, genetics and access to healthy environments are the true determinants of individual health.
We know our guests are proactive health consumers who care about the health of themselves and their families. The demographic of our guest (with above average education and above average income) means that many of these determinants of health (such as income, social status, education) are relatively constant but an important problem persists: at the point in time when guests are making choices on products that will impact their health, they lack the key social network and incentive that will reinforce the healthy choice.
Enter Cartwheel Healthy Connect. By harnessing the popularity and footprint of Cartwheel and combining it with behavioral science, Cartwheel Healthy Connect reinforces the guest in making healthy choices by winning on price and winning at health.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
There are two parts to this equation.
First, the state of the health of America is dire.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ 64% of Americans are overweight & obese
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ At least 1 in 4 people eat some type of fast food every day; average fast food meal totals 830 calories, which means in the one meal, people are eating almost half of their daily calories.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ This generation of children will be the first in history to not be healthier than their parents.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Diabetes is the fastest growing disease and diabetes medication is the fastest growing pharmaceutical industries in the market.
Second, behavioral science has consistently found that health is contagious. The health of one individual impacts the health of their friends and family. This fact is at the foundation of successful population health efforts: to improve the health of the whole, the network and environment of the individual must be harnessed.
As humans we are born to follow, we are suckers for advertising, deals, and the easiest way to get our results. Health improvement isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t easyÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ when we try to make major changes. BUT, when we take health improvement in small doses, easy steps, and with othersÃ¢â‚¬Â¦we prevail!
ideas.idea_solution:
The consumer will experience Cartwheel as it is today with enhancements. Guests can identify 3 people to be in their Ã¢â‚¬Å“Cartwheel CircleÃ¢â‚¬Â. Across categories, from produce to C9 to owned brands and wearableÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s, the more healthy choices each individual makes within the Circle makes, the more rewards each individual earns.
Guests within a Cartwheel Circle are rewarded with fixed rewards (like those in todayÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s app) and then can earn variable rewards (surprise and delight); these are unexpected incentives like gift cards and free coffee. These two reward types are proven to motivate even the unmovable and grasp the hearts of the demanding enthusiasts.
Cartwheel Healthy Connect is the first behavioral health aggregation platform that rewards the health of you and those you love. Cartwheel Healthy Connect can literally change the population health footprint! Target can drive access; health literacy, and motivation just by connecting family, then friends, then community.

ideas.idea_description: Sam is a 24 year old young professional from a home that did not value healthy habits, but Sam does. Sam wants to be healthy and eco-friendly but does not know how to start, nor has the time, inspiration, or resources. Sam needs a convenient way to adopt healthy habits that align with his goal of having a healthy and environmentally conscious lifestyle.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: We know more than one-third of U.S. adults are obese. The Journal of Neuroscience finds that the constant struggle to make healthy choices is not a question of will, but of overcoming unhealthy thoughts. These unhealthy decisions do not end at our food, but extend into the products in our homes and in our garbage. From this, we see that young adults buy what is convenient and familiar which lead to unhealthy choices.
ideas.idea_solution: Adults now check their phones more than 1,500 times a week. This makes applications an easy way to engage the consumer. Therefore the need for a wellness based rewards application is very real. Our application does just that by tracking healthy habits. If the user has a fitness tracking device, completes a daily workout, checks-in at their gym, or purchases athletic merchandise the user receives fitness points. If the user purchases featured meals or purchases healthy food options they receive food reward points. If the user purchases an environmentally friendly product from Target or attends a sponsored volunteer event they receive environment reward points. These points roll up to total wellness points, which can be redeemed for gift cards and other promotional wellness rewards. The use of this application promotes healthy choices through positive reinforcement, which helps develop and maintain healthy habits.

ideas.idea_description:
Wellness for people can mean many different things but at its core people want to live a healthy life. There are endless options for people to choose from but they have trouble finding motivation, the right type of activities, healthy food alternatives and they lack time to figure it all out alone. With Target Lifestyle, Target will help you learn more about yourself, help make the best choices to live a healthy life that fits your style! Target will be the partner everyone needs in their wellness journey.
Take Jackie, she is an active and social individual who isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t a traditional gym goer that needs help finding undiscovered way to continue her journey living well and eating healthy. She is bored with her routine and lacks the knowledge and time to do something that feels more fulfilling. With Target Lifestyle, she is given activities tailored to her interests and tips to keep her wellness journey fresh. First using the wellness quiz she, is given activities that fit her lifestyle and preferences. It then connects her to products and grocery items with meal recipes that will make her life easier. Creating a community is also a large part, Target will host special wellness events around the city that will bring her and people like her together.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
People love to gain knowledge on how to live a healthy life, have their plan flow fluidly, and enjoy each day. We will do this by:
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Streamlining what they like with a quiz and giving them activities that align to their preferences
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Provide them with products and recipes that will make what they love to do easier
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Create a central location for people to share their inspiration, wellness parties ideas, and connect with other people
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Allows Target to be a partner in their wellness journey by hosting Target Lifestyle events to create a community and bring people together: Roller Rally, Yoga in the Park, Target Chef Class, Live Well with Target
ideas.idea_solution: Consumers will create a profile which will start with the quiz and begin their journey. Their profile/dashboard will lead them to activities they love, products + coupons they will need to make their lives easier, and link them to the Target Lifestyle social network that connects them to people like them.

ideas.idea_description: Meet Molly.  Molly is a 30 something working mom who struggles to find the time and motivation to cook nutritious, good tasting meals that her family will actually eat.  She dreads weekend grocery shopping with her children and feels defeated and guilty when she resorts to fast food meals for convenience.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: To the Target guest, a key component of wellness is healthy eating.  Yet, guest insights show us that all segments struggle with eating well consistently, citing motivation and time as the biggest barriers. There is currently not a solution in the marketplace that addresses the time suck of recipe searching and grocery shopping that includes a subscription service with predictive user level customization(like Netflix), nutritional tracking over time, the power of Target's whole store assortment, all while providing ongoing motivation to cook healthy.
ideas.idea_solution:
Target Healthy Meal solutions helps eliminate the time associated with finding recipes and shopping for ingredients, while providing ongoing motivation to make healthy choices through online networks.

Molly simply creates a profile one time by choosing how frequently recipes will be pushed, her dietary preferences: protein, allergies, low fat, etc , delivery preferences and order frequency. Target will match those selections with curated recipes featuring recipes from our merch partners, like Rachael Ray and our inner circle blogging partners, such as Skinnytaste. Per MollyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s designated cadence, Target will push relevant recipes to her. Recipes will feature ingredients from made to matter and Target owned brand products. Target will also link cartwheel offers related to ingredients. Molly's homepage will also track dollars saved per recipe and total savings per year.

Recipes are reviewed by other community members of Target Healthy Meal Solutions and nutritional info is clearly posted on each recipe. Instructional video clips accompany recipes.

Molly can select all recipe ingredients to be added to her virtual cart, or deselect ingredients that she already has at home. Groceries will be available for delivery or in store pick up.

Finally Molly can join networks specific to her needs. If she is interested in connecting with others about picky eaters and weight loss, so can join these networks to share tips and tricks. This will help motivate her to continue with healthy meal choices.

ideas.idea_title: Target To Table - Easy Dinner Brought to Your Car
ideas.idea_description:
WhatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s for dinner?

Every day, this simple question strikes a lightning rod of stress and guilt into the heart of a working parent.Target To Table gives our guest a chance to make a healthy, yummy dinner at home without the hassle of planning, shopping or doing too much cooking.
Meet Emily - She knows that her kids need fresh, healthy food. She knows about the studies- kids who eat dinner with their family at home get better grades and are less likely to do drugs. She wants that happy life for her kids more than she wants happiness for herself, she plans family vacations months in advance and drives across town for swimming lessons in a heated salt water pool, yet there never seems to be time to plan for a healthy dinner she can feel proud of.
Nearly every night Emily feels like the worst mom in the world, as she orders pizza or Bite Squad, or pulls into DQ for chicken fingers. She wants to change, she wants to give her kids great food every night but just doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have the time to think ahead to plan and cook healthy dinners.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
Moms and dads both work, according to the Bureau of Labor 59% of families with kids have two working parents which means that no one is home thinking about dinner on a weekday afternoon. Kids are in more organized activities than ever before and it all adds up to families spending less time eating together. According to NYU Langone Medical Center, family dinners have decreased 28% over the last 20 years.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Target has found that itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not just burnt out parents like Emily, but ALL guest segments struggle with eating well and want to improve.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Plated, Freshology, HelloFresh and HomeChef can bring you ingredients for dinner, but they are expensive, charge for delivery and require a few days of advance notice. They canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t help when you need dinner TONIGHT.
ideas.idea_solution:
Target To Table is seamless and easy.
1. The guest orders a dinner from an app on her phone, or online at her desk at work.
On Tuesday at 3 pm she can select a healthy (and yummy) meal from a list of options and select a time to get it.

2. Everything needed for dinner is in one bag that is delivered to the guest at home -- or walked out to the guestÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s car in the Target parking lot -- or picked up in store Ã¢â‚¬â€œ the guest decides and Target makes it happen

The Target To Table bag is filled with pre-measured ingredients and easy to follow instructions on what to do with them. Parents serve the dinner on their own plates, kids donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t even realize that mom or dad uses Target To Table, they just know that dinner is yummy and they feel good.

ideas.idea_description: Sam is a 24 year old young professional who moved to a new city and is establishing their new identity. Sam came from a home that did not value healthy habits, but he now values the idea of being healthy. Sam wants to be healthy and environmentally conscious but does not know how to start, nor has the time, inspiration, or resources. Sam needs a convenient way to adopt healthy habits that align with his goal of having a healthy and eco-friendly lifestyle.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: We know more than one-third of U.S. adults are obese. The Journal of Neuroscience finds that the constant struggle to make healthy choices is not a question of will, but of overcoming unhealthy thoughts. These unhealthy decisions do not end at our food, but extend into the products in our homes and in our garbage. From this, we see that young adults buy what is convenient and familiar which lead to unhealthy choices.
ideas.idea_solution:
Adults now check their phones more than 1,500 times a week. This makes applications an easy way to engage the consumer. Therefore the need for a wellness based rewards application is very real. Our application does just that by tracking healthy habits. If the user has a fitness tracking device, completes a daily workout, checks-in at their gym, or purchases athletic merchandise the user receives fitness points. If the user purchases featured meals or purchases healthy food options they receive food reward points. If the user purchases an environmentally friendly product from Target or attends a sponsored volunteer event they receive environment reward points. These points roll up to total wellness points, which can be redeemed for gift cards and other promotional wellness rewards. The use of this application promotes healthy choices through positive reinforcement, which helps develop and maintain healthy habits.


***Access to Video: Crowd*** (with capital C)

ideas.idea_description: Lack of time within our busy lifestyles and costs for organic, whole foods can be a contributing factor in making poor food choices. Additionally, meal preparation is time consuming and can be costly. A meal preparation app can minimizes preparation, organization and time to plan and execute healthy meals each week for individuals and their families while also providing a seamless guest experience, healthy products and options!
ideas.idea_guest_insight: After connecting with five individuals to discuss them and their familyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s well-being goals, all five mentioned eating healthy as a key goal, but that time, planning and organization were key barriers in achieving this wellness goal. Three of the five also mentioned that they would like to experiment with new Ã¢â‚¬Å“healthierÃ¢â‚¬Â recipes that their families would enjoy.
ideas.idea_solution:
Create a meal planning app that aggregates and organizes recipes into a shopping list and/or offers curb-side pick-up to minimize time, organization and hassle of healthy meal planning and preparation:
1. The user fills out a profile when getting started that share any healthy eating preferences / goals and dietary restrictions (gluten-free, lactose free, all organic, grass-fed meats, etc.), etc.
a. The user can also set default brands, Target store locations, manage their pantry inventory, add payment information, etc.
b. It would be a bonus if Target could also offer local community-supported agricultural program that the guest could opt into as a part of this program
c. The profile can also ask the guest if they want suggestions on recipes based on searches, healthier swaps for ingredients or freshness dates and reminders on purchases
d. The profile can also hold payment options, such as their Target red card, Apple Pay / CurrentC, or Target.com profile
2. The app allows individuals to upload pictures of recipes, integrates with social media sites (such as Pinterest or common recipe apps to gain access to the recipes that the user wants to make) or offers a recipe catalog the user can search and select from
a. Recipe catalog can be sorted many different ways, by ingredients, prep time, top rated, health index, gluten free, kid preferred, etc.
b. It also could allow you to send recipes to friends, roommates or significant others or share via social media
3. The user can finalize the shopping list after it is aggregated to:
a. Remove items they currently have (i.e. I already have olive oil, spices, etc) in your pantry
b. Add other Target items into the list for ease of shopping at this time
c. Confirms size /quantities based on recipes (maybe we can have metrics on the back end to make a suggestions)
4. The user can also select how the recipe ingredients should be aggregated for delivery
a. The app can sort into a shopping list by aisle (maybe at some point weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d have beacon technology to show the guest where the ingredient is in relation to where they are in the store).
i. The list should also be able to be exported to text or email to send to a significant other or partner, roommate for pick-up
ii. The list can also sync and be updated real-time so that partners/roommates can add/delete or change throughout the day and the guest has the most updated list
b. The app offers a pick-up curb side option for those in a hurry but want to prepare a healthy meal
i. The guest can select a 30 minute window for in-store pick-up
c. Maybe one-day we could even deliver or acquire a grocery delivery company!
5. The app will also search Cartwheel and manufacturerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s coupons to deliver value and deals to the consumer
6. The guest then selects payment option already stored in profile and clicks Ã¢â‚¬Å“doneÃ¢â‚¬Â

ideas.idea_description:
**** WATCH OUR VIDEO: https://vimeo.com/118965884 ***





Wellness Wendy is motivated to help her family eat well, but her kids refuse when she tries to serve them healthy alternatives. Our concept associates popular kidsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ brands/characters with healthy foods to increase consumption and remove the guilt that is experienced when she is forced to serve less healthy options. These popular brands/characters possess the highest level of credibility with kids, and our concept lends Ã¢â‚¬Å“magical powersÃ¢â‚¬Â to Wendy during mealtime.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
Kids are picky and they have a preference for unhealthy foods. Licensed products today are typically associated with snacks, candy, and treats. Parents we interviewed have tried providing healthy alternatives, with no success based on refusal. In our interviews, we also heard that having to deal with push back makes the meal process a more time-intensive one, causing additional stress.





Based on research from NPD Group, we know that 58% of parents say that their childrenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s adoration for a particular brand or character influences their preference in toys, games, decorative, etc. In that same survey, 37% said a byproduct of that adoration is it Ã¢â‚¬Å“brings the funÃ¢â‚¬Â to any item associated. Furthermore, the survey stated a childÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s affinity for certain brands/characters helps make the lives of those around them a bit easier.





Based on Guests Insights research, 40% of consumers made license product purchases in the last 3 months with Grocery making up the 3rd largest pyramid for license purchases behind Hardlines & Apparel.
ideas.idea_solution:
1. While shopping at Target, online or in-store, the product catches the GuestsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ eye.





2. Identified as a trusted licensed-solution for a quick, HEALTHY meal, sheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s intrigued.





a. UNIQUE TWIST: Featuring cauliflower as an ingredient, she notices the association with Frozen by renaming cauliflower, Ã¢â‚¬Å“ElsaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ice TreesÃ¢â‚¬Â.





b. TIME: She also clearly understands the time necessary to prepare the meal with a clear callout on the packaging.





c. DISTRACTION: Equal in length to cooking time, exclusive-digital video content is provided to Ã¢â‚¬Å“entertainÃ¢â‚¬Â her kids while preparing the meal, and help her kids continue the magical journey, overcoming their dislike of healthy foods. Mom will see this as a temporary baby-sitter, freeing up time to focus on the meal.

ideas.idea_description:
Please view video: https://vimeo.com/118962135 password "crowd"

Meet Molly. Molly is a 30 something working mom who struggles to find the time and motivation to cook nutritious, good tasting meals that her family will actually eat. She dreads weekend grocery shopping with her children and feels defeated and guilty when she resorts to fast food meals for convenience.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: To the Target guest, a key component of wellness is healthy eating. Yet, guest insights show us that all segments struggle with eating well consistently, citing motivation and time as the biggest barriers. There is currently not a solution in the marketplace that addresses the time suck of recipe searching and grocery shopping that includes a subscription service with predictive user level customization(like Netflix), nutritional tracking over time, the power of Target's whole store assortment, all while providing ongoing motivation to cook healthy.
ideas.idea_solution:
Target Healthy Meal solutions helps eliminate the time associated with finding recipes and shopping for ingredients, while providing ongoing motivation to make healthy choices through online networks.







Molly simply creates a profile one time by choosing how frequently recipes will be pushed, her dietary preferences: protein, allergies, low fat, etc , delivery preferences and order frequency. Target will match those selections with curated recipes featuring recipes from our merch partners, like Rachael Ray and our inner circle blogging partners, such as Skinnytaste. Per MollyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s designated cadence, Target will push relevant recipes to her. Recipes will feature ingredients from made to matter and Target owned brand products. Target will also link cartwheel offers related to ingredients. Molly's homepage will also track dollars saved per recipe and total savings per year.







Recipes are reviewed by other community members of Target Healthy Meal Solutions and nutritional info is clearly posted on each recipe. Instructional video clips accompany recipes.







Molly can select all recipe ingredients to be added to her virtual cart, or deselect ingredients that she already has at home. Groceries will be available for delivery or in store pick up.







Finally Molly can join networks specific to her needs. If she is interested in connecting with others about picky eaters and weight loss, so can join these networks to share tips and tricks. This will help motivate her to continue with healthy meal choices.

ideas.idea_title: Hello. Healthy.  Fresh Organic Meal Options
ideas.idea_description: Consumer research indicates that while guestsÃ¢â‚¬â€and especially MillennialsÃ¢â‚¬â€care about eating fresh, healthy, organic meals, they lack the ability, inspiration and time to make planning, shopping for and preparing meals a daily priority.  Guests increasingly look to their primary grocery to help navigate food-based wellness and as a resource for outsourcing meal preparation.  Retailers who are successful in fulfilling this need experience an uplift in their credibility as a trusted wellness source across assortments.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
The Food Marketing InstituteÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s U.S. Grocery Shopping Trends 2014 and TargetÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Guest Insights support our concept.




Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Millenials look to grocery as a viable option for cooking outsourcing. For Millenials, top drivers of grocer-prepared food consumption include cheaper prepared foods (55%) and better quality prepared foods (52%).




Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Millenials value cooking from scratch, but only 34% feel they have the knowledge to do it well, often with reliance on Ã¢â‚¬Å“assemblyÃ¢â‚¬Â cooking.




Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Planned eating/shopping made way for immediate and same-day consumption. Immediate consumption is no longer relegated to snacks and planned restaurant meals; itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s now a normal part of food management. 25% of all meals consumed by tweny-somethings include items purchased the same day.




Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Health and well-being, including how foods are made/sourced and their nutritional content, have emerged as one fo the central guiding principles of todayÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s eating culture. Consumers shop for foods that satisfy multiple health attributes focusing on good fiber, avoidance of negative ingredients (sugar, sodium, preservatives), minimal processing, heart health and positive nutrition.




Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Consumers increasingly look to food retailers to become trusted allies in helping shoppers navigate food and wellness. 43% of consumers cited their primary food store as the source to help them stay healthy, beating health insurance companies (26%), government institutions (20%), the media (20%) and celebrity chefs (14%).




Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Securing consumer trust in the health attributes of a retailers grocery attributes correlates with consumers having the greatest trust in their store as a wellness ally.
ideas.idea_solution:
Guests will experience the Hello Healthy meal program as follows:





1. In partnership with a trusted media source for nutrition information, such as Cooking Light, Target will assemble the ingredients needed to create healthy, chef-driven and dietitian-reviewed meals focused on wellness brands, healthier ingredients (lower fat, higher fiber, lower sodium, etc.) and organics. Recipes will be culled from Cooking LightÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s monthly magazine selection, lending trust and legitimacy to TargetÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s nutrition claims while affording great opportunities for cross promotion (in store, in magazine).





2. Using an online digital/mobile platform, guests will enter their meal preferences including the number and frequency of meals theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d like to receive, any dietary restrictions and preferences, the size of their family, and their preferred fulfillment option.







3. At the frequency requested by the guest, Target will assemble pre-portioned ingredients and easy-to-follow meal assembly instructions for the guest to prepare at home. Guests can pick up their weekly meal boxes in store or have them delivered to their homes.







4. Upon receipt of their boxes, guests can quickly and easily assemble fresh, home-cooked meals for their families, confident that the recipes and ingredients are healthy and that the meals will inspire their families to eat well.







5. For guests on the go, Target will offer an alternate option to these assemble-at-home boxes. Instead, guests can alternately purchase ready-to-eat, warm meal options to go from a transformed, health-focused Food Avenue. Replacing the many unhealthy options currently available at Food Avenue will simultaneously lend credibility to TargetÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s wellness platform.







Other Considerations:







Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Target could promote Hello Healthy through celebrity chefs and dietitiansÃ¢â‚¬â€our partners or Cooking LightÃ¢â‚¬â„¢sÃ¢â‚¬â€lending further legitimacy to the mealsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ health claims while generating inspiration and excitement







Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Target could partner with small growers to include locally sourced foods in their boxes, building on consumer enthusiasm for CSA shares, but without the hassles of time-consuming preparation







Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Target could leverage Hello Healthy meal boxes to introduce guests to other wellness products from assortments beyond grocery: personal care, beauty, household chemicals, etc.







Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ If successful, Target could expand the program to focus on other kinds of meals: breakfasts, lunches, dinner parties, etc.

ideas.idea_title: Be Well - Wellness App integrated within Target Healthful
ideas.idea_description:
Video Link: https://vimeo.com/119090949
pw: crowd

Everyone wants to be their best version of Ã¢â‚¬Å“well.Ã¢â‚¬Â But what does well mean? For some being well may be eating better and getting to the gym if they havenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t been there for a while. For others it may mean being civic-minded and volunteering at their local shelter or donating extra clothes they have around their house. Since being well means something different to everyone, providing a cookie-cutter, one-size-fits-all wellness plan doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t work. People want to make their own wellness choices based on whatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most important to them and fits into their busy lifestyles. They just need a little help.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: In doing research with various friends and families, it became clear that wellness highly varied from person to person. An individualsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ passion for a wellness initiative highly varied, and for ones they weren't passionate about, they didn't want to be reminded they weren't taking part. This exposed the need for a wellness app that was customizable and relevant to them. When asked how Target can help them choose a wellness lifestyle, the common theme was asking for Target to reward or incent them to choose a wellness lifestyle.
ideas.idea_solution: Consumers will open the Target Healthful app which they already know and love for helping them manage their Target prescriptions. Be Well, the Wellness side of the Target Healthful App, will let the guest customize what Wellness initiatives will help them Be Well, while encouraging them to maintain that lifestyle. Whether itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s connecting them with volunteering events, offering them rewards for completing fitness challenges, providing additional incentives to shop healthy, or helping them discover sustainable products at Target, Be Well will promote an encouraging and relevant way for our guest to live a wellness lifestyle. Be Well doesn't try to replace their fitness app or be some super all encompassing wellness app. It simply makes wellness fun and easy by offering incentives to choose a wellness lifestyle relevant to them.

ideas.idea_title: [Project Title] TBD Hope you like the concept anyway
ideas.idea_description:
Riley, our tech-savvy digitally connected guest, knows what he needs to do to be healthy. He is up on wellness trends and knows that he wants to have a better balanced lifestyle. Unfortunately, Riley doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have a way to get there. When he is faced with tough choices, Riley doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t always have the time or energy to make the best decision. Often times his decisions donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t line up with his aspirational goals.
He needs a way to believe that a healthy lifestyle is attainable, but feels discouraged in the face of past failures and the perceived time and effort necessary to make sustained lifestyle changes.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: Too many times we have seen friends, family, or ourselves go on the yo-yo wellness phases. First we start off so excited to get into a better lifestyle, but then the inevitable happens. We become discouraged and give up. The time and effort needed to log your Ã¢â‚¬Å“pointsÃ¢â‚¬Â, track your Ã¢â‚¬Å“activitiesÃ¢â‚¬Â, buy and prepare your food, etc. is way too much and doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t seem even possible to become a sustainable lifestyle.
ideas.idea_solution:
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Low EffortÃ¢â‚¬â€providing analytics on their behavior to better inform choices
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Consistent and AccountableÃ¢â‚¬â€regular communication and reference point for benchmarking progress
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ PersonalizedÃ¢â‚¬â€what are your wellness goals? Are your goals Ã¢â‚¬Å“organic only kitchenÃ¢â‚¬Â, Ã¢â‚¬Å“bleach-free householdÃ¢â‚¬Â, Ã¢â‚¬Å“all natural beautyÃ¢â‚¬Â?
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ IntegratedÃ¢â‚¬â€online experience linked with your existing Target accounts (cartwheel, lists, recipes), in-store experience to help you make decisions in aisle, personalized recommendations based on your shopping patterns
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Rewards-- incentives to continue with progress via personalized coupons, tips and tricks to keep you on track
After Riley signs up for [Project Title], he receives a bi-weekly email summarizing his shopping patterns. He can see how much of his purchases qualify as wellness compared to non-wellness items. Wellness is predefined as Ã¢â‚¬Å“organicÃ¢â‚¬Â, but Riley wants to take his wellness journey one step further. He can log into his account and personalize his settings to align with his vegan lifestyle change. This way, now his wellness tracker will reward him only for his vegan purchases, and help him make decisions that align with his lifestyle choice. When he goes back to the store, Riley is confronted with difficult decisions in the soup aisleÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ he canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t tell which soups are vegan. He pulls out his phone and is able to scan the item to make sure that it qualifies for his wellness tracker. He continues to have difficult decisions in the cleaning aisle and skin care aisle, but his phone helps him make the right decision immediately so he doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have to stress.
Over time, Riley gets suggestions sent to him on easy product swaps and recipe suggestions. He used to only buy rice, but was suggested to try quinoa and now he loves it! He also gets suggestions on easy recipes based on products he has bought in the past couple weeks so that he can live his desired lifestyle the easiest way possible. He can see his progress over time on his profile and gets additional coupons as he improves.
*Sorry, we couldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t figure out how to add audio to our video. Best experience is when listening to https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-i5MU14JLdw

ideas.idea_description: Our guests love vitamins and they know that their bodies aren't getting enough. The problem is they don't know what they're lacking in or what would help them lead healthier lives. So what if we could help them identify their deficiencies and direct them to the Target solution?
ideas.idea_guest_insight: Stand in the vitamin aisle at Target and observe the blank faces of our guests as they try to figure out if they should buy some Vitamin A, D, C, B12, B9, or B5. Or maybe they just need a tablespoon of magnesium? Let's help them out.
ideas.idea_solution: Non-invasive technology is becoming available (www.vitastiq.com) that can test your vitamin and mineral levels with just a swipe across your skin. Similar to blood-pressure monitors in drug stores, Target can offer an elegant in-store test for our guests. This allows Target to become a partner in wellness and drive sales in the vitamin aisle. One feature could be a color-coded system in the aisle. If the test displays you're low in B12 (Light Blue) the vitamin jar in store can be light blue.

ideas.idea_description:
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Not knowing what to cook
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Not knowing the nutrition of meal options
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Not having time to plan healthy meals
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Not having time to convert recipes into shopping lists
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Not knowing where products are located
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Not knowing if recipe ingredients are discounted on Cartwheel
ideas.idea_guest_insight:

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Need to manually convert ingredients into a shopping list
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Forget to click on recipes or buy key ingredients

ideas.idea_solution:
Minimal Viable Product (MVP):
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Integrate Target Recipes into the Target App Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Search for recipes

Future Scope:

ideas.idea_description: Here's the deal.  You're a busy Mom/Dad and little Charlie is sick.  Not sick enough to go to the doctor or clinic, but just miserable enough to need something to ease some of the symptoms.
ideas.idea_guest_insight: It's all subjective and unquantifiable, but any parent can relate to the tension and stress that comes with having a sick kiddo at home.  Anything to make that easier would be a welcome idea.
ideas.idea_solution: It's easy.  Mom/Dad simply logon to Target.com.  From a protal they enter their child's symptoms, any allergies, etc.  This information is sent to a nearby store pharmacy (or clinic) and the pharmacist (or practitioner) looks at the symptoms and picks out over-the-counter products that they personally recommend and should help poor Charlie out.  These items are packed in branded 'Get Better' kits along with a personalized note (to Charlie) from the pharmacist (or clinician) with the pharmacy (or clinic) phone number (in case Mom/Dad have any questions).  The kit is ready to be sent to the service desk.  Mom/Dad are then alrerted and they can swing by Target to pick up their kit.  In a flash they are back home and little Charlie gets a healthy dose of Target care, service and support.

ideas.idea_description: Guests do not know the status of their prescription while waiting.  We send text alerts, but guests still check back at the pharmacy to see if it is ready.  This creates congestion around the pharmacy and lines appear unorganized and haphazard.  We do a good job of letting guests know when their prescription is ready, but not a good job letting them know the status along the way, especially if there is an issue that may cause a delay (insurance error, have to call doctor)
ideas.idea_guest_insight: Guest insights data has shown us that customers only like to stop by the pharmacy once, not to check-in, check back and then come back to pick-up/pay.  A majority will also come back 5-10 minutes earlier then when we promised their prescriptions would be ready.  Guests perceive the lines to be longer than they are and that the pharmacy team is disorganized.
ideas.idea_solution: Take the Domino's pizza tracker as a base line.  We start by letting you know we received your prescription (no more checking in at the pharmacy when your doc has submitted an electronic prescription just to see if we got it).  Then we will let you know if it is being processed/filled; also letting you know if anything has come up that is causing a delay.  Finally we will let you know when the pharmacist has checked it and it is ready to be picked up.  We will keep you 'in-the-know' the entire way.  No need to check-in with us.  We would also integrate an online pay system to make the checkout process even faster and easier.

ideas.idea_description:
Consumer Problem: Consumers do not have a convenient way to get their clothing dry cleaned in an environmentally friendly, sustainable manner.

Target Problem: Target is looking to drive additional traffic by providing a product or service that guests desire and strengthens the link to our brandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s wellness initiative.

Concept: Create a green, one-hour dry cleaning service that allows guests the opportunity to complete their weekly shopping trip while taking care of their laundry.
ideas.idea_guest_insight:
Reasons to Believe:
- Affordable, environmentally-friendly dry cleaning services are difficult to find and inconvenient
- The guest with a dry-cleaning need is affluent.
- The guest who needs dry-cleaning uses the service on a routine basis, driving regular trips.
- The guest who uses Target as their Dry Cleaning destination will either comeÃ¢â‚¬Â¦
Ã¢â‚¬Â¦twice a week, once to drop-off and once to pick-up.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¦once a week, shopping Target for one-hour until Dry Cleaning is complete
ideas.idea_solution:
- Green-friendly, best-in-class Dry Cleaning Service with a brand name that over-indexes at Target and with a service that has yet to be linked to a retailer (e.g., opportunity to brand or co-brand). Link with top green name like 7th Generation or Method and create brand hub in the same way Tide Dry Cleaning Services are rolling out throughout the country
- Create pick-up/drop-off at the top 200 ship-from-store locations
- Allows for efficient drop off/pick-up of dry cleaning & ship-to-store Target merchandise
- Quick, drive-through opportunity for ship-from-store coordination with USPS/UPS/Fedex
- Opportunity to bundle with task-rabbit or other third-party delivery service to provide dry cleaning & Target products all-in-one car load (economies of scale).
- Target to launch personalized, delivery-from-store car service or off-hours Uber trip that provides guests their full needs at a discount price. Example: Ship from store to your house in one-day for $10 if youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re within 10 miles.
- Pricing: Loss leader or competitive pricing to drive trips to the store.
